titles.title: Saki: Achiga Hen - Episode of Side-A
Saki 2
Saki - Episodul laturei A
咲 阿知賀編 episode of side-A
Saki Episode of Side A
天才麻将少女 阿知贺篇 episode of side-A

recommendations.recommendation: Just like usual "sports" anime, you`ll ends up liking it mainly because of the embellished images of your favorite sports. So if you didn`t like mahjong or hating table games overall, turn back and look for another anime. But if you somehow find the "first season" entertaining, then try watching this, but don`t expect too much just because the first season is somehow entertaining.

Screw the rating, since it`s probably just people who watched it for the first time, thinking it`s another one of those moe animes that they can easily get into.
For fans, since it IS a side story of the original, and for people who are interested in ability mahjong. This series LACKS details of the matches, which is a drag, but eh!

anime.description: The Achiga Girls` Academy in Nara once defeated regional mahjong powerhouse Bansei High School. It advanced into the national team semifinals but lost to the eventual champion, and the mahjong club was later disbanded. Six years later, elementary school student http://anidb.net/ch39190 [Takakamo Shizuno] befriends transfer student http://anidb.net/ch3833 [Haramura Nodoka]. The two eventually enter Achiga Girls`, but Nodoka transfers out of the school in the second year. When Shizuno sees Nodoka on television the following year as the national middle school individual mahjong champion, she decides to revive Achiga`s mahjong club. Source: MAL

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: nopan
tag.description: The character foregoes underwear.

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: energetic
tag.description: An energetic character, often also called a genki character, shows great, often excessive levels of activity or vitality, and seems to always be doing everything extra fast. Genki characters are often slightly, or sometimes very, eccentric, and are filled with confidence and determination, regardless of whether they are competent or not; in fact, they often have little to no actual competence at whatever they generally do. Although genki characters are usually played exclusively for comedy effect, sometimes they may slow down for a serious or introspective moment. The most common genki character archetype is the genki schoolgirl, who will often be late to school and run with a toast in her mouth.

tag.name: mahjong
tag.description: Mahjong is a tile-based game, which was developed in China during the Qing dynasty. It is commonly played by four players. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: board games
tag.description: People here play a board game. It can vary from chess and Go, to Monopoly, to Dungeons and Dragons.

tag.name: shoujo ai
tag.description: Shoujo Ai means girls love, and thus explores what happens when two girls (or women) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2695 [Yuri] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphic sex. The male version is http://anidb.net/t2783 [Shounen Ai]. http://anidb.net/t7146 [Cute girls doing cute things (CGDCT)] is often mistaken as low level Yuri or Shoujo Ai. If there is no Yuri or Shoujo Ai subtext, i.e. if there is no romantic subtext, only tag CGDCT. Please note: CGDCT and yuri/shoujo ai are not mutually exclusive; it is possible to have an anime tagged both.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: female student
tag.description: Pretty much exclusive to hentai shows only unless an ecchi show has implied sex and/or a strong indicator of nudity. A character is considered a student if she goes to school, doesn`t matter if it`s high school, college or homeschooling, but she should be of appropriate age for a student; a housewife going to college should not get this category.

tag.name: chibi ED
tag.description: Some or all of the endings feature chibi versions of the characters.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: adapted into JDrama
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a JDrama. A JDrama (Japanese drama), also called "terebi dorama" ("television drama") or "dorama" for short, is a Japanese live action television series. Japan produces many drama series every year, from a huge variety of genres. Like anime, they generally air in three-month seasons or multiples thereof, with new shows airing every season. Some kinds of drama, especially the morning or afternoon ones, tend to be broadcast daily, while evening ones tend to be broadcast weekly, also like anime. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: adapted into Japanese movie
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into a Japanese movie. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

tag.name: adapted into other media
tag.description: This anime is a http://anidb.net/t2797 [new original work], and it has been adapted into other media formats. In exceedingly rare instances, a specific episode of a new original work anime can also be adapted.

character.name: Sawamura Tomoki
character.description: Sawamura Tomoki is a second year student at Ryuumonbuchi High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Inoue Jun
character.description: Inoue Jun is a second year student at Ryuumonbuchi High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kunihiro Hajime
character.description: Kunihiro Hajime is a second year student at Ryuumonbuchi High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Miyanaga Saki
character.description: Miyanaga Saki is a high school freshman and is the main heroine of the story. She initially joins the Mahjong Club so she can reach Nationals to see her sister, a top-ranked mahjong player. She is notorious for her ability to score zero points every round. Her skill primarily comes from her ability to read her opponents and their tiles to see the flow of the game. At the mahjong tournament, she is made the captain of the team.

character.name: Haramura Nodoka
character.description: Haramura Nodoka is a high school freshman who attends the same school as Saki and is a member of the Mahjong Club. She was the previous year`s National Middle School Individual Champion. Her skill, in comparison to Saki`s, comes from practicing via online mahjong. At the mahjong tournament, she is the vice-captain of the team. Her nickname is "Nodocchi" after her play style, quickly and efficiently racking up points as quickly as possible.

character.name: Suga Kyoutarou
character.description: Suga Kyoutarou is http://anidb.net/ch3832 [Saki]`s male friend who joined the mahjong club before her and is the one responsible for bringing her to the Kiyosumi mahjong club. He has a crush on http://anidb.net/ch3833 [Nodoka].

character.name: Someya Mako
character.description: Someya Mako is a second year student at Kiyosumi High School and plays the sergeant (2nd) position. Mako was introduced to mahjong at an early age as her grandfather owned a mahjong parlor and she regularly visited there (she now works there as a waitress). As a result of this, she picks up her peculiar speech manner and more importantly her special ability. Nicknamed "Spindle Territory", it allows her to memorize games she has seen or played in so as to be able to recall them in similar situations. She utilizes this when she takes her glasses off.

character.name: Kataoka Yuuki
character.description: Kataoka Yuuki is a high school freshman who attends the same school as Saki and is a member of the Mahjong Club. She, like the other members of the Mahjong Club, is highly skilled. However, she cannot stay focused and makes more mistakes as the game progresses. She is often seen eating tacos, which seem to increase her skill when playing mahjong. Additionally, food with names similar to taco, like the Japanese hot dogs sliced like an octopus can increase her skill partially as well.

character.name: Takei Hisa
character.description: Takei Hisa is a third year student at Kiyosumi High School, and plays the lieutenant (3rd) position on the team. She is the president of the mahjong club, as well as the student congress president.

character.name: Kajiki Yumi
character.description: Kajiki Yumi is a third year at Tsuruga Academy and is one of its key members. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kanbara Satomi
character.description: Kanbara Satomi is a third year Tsuruga Academy and the president of the schools mahjong club. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Tsuyama Mutsuki
character.description: Tsuyama Mutsuki is a second year at Tsuruga Academy. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Senoo Kaori
character.description: Senoo Kaori is a second year at Tsuruga Academy. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Ikeda Kana
character.description: Ikeda Kana is a second year student at Kazekoshi Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Yoshitome Miharu
character.description: Yoshitome Miharu is a second year at Kazekoshi Girls School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Miyanaga Teru
character.description: Miyanaga Teru is Saki`s older sister and multiple Champion in the national Mahjong Tournament.

character.name: Nishida Junko
character.description: Reporter for the "Weekly Mahjong Today"

character.name: Touyoko Momoko
character.description: Momoko is Yumi`s friend, and a high school first year student. She has a lacking presence, and is often ignored by her friends despite her efforts to gain attention; as such, she soon gave up on building relationships with other people. After a match through LAN mahjong, Yumi acknowledges Momoko`s skills and finds her; the two become friends afterwards. Her mahjong playing ability comes when she augments her negative presence into an advantageous stealth state, causing her opponents to miss her moves.

character.name: Takakamo Shizuno
character.description: Takakamo Shizuno is a first year at Achiga Girls School. In her elementary days she befriended Nodoka Haramura and together played mahjong in the middle/high school mahjong club. She was the clubs second best player before it was disband. Her goal is to go to the nationals and play against Nodoka. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Atarashi Ako
character.description: Atarashi Ako is a first year at Achiga Girls` School. She is an elementary-school friend of Shizuno and Nodoka Haramura, but went to a different middle school so she could play mahjong. In the Achiga mahjong club, she was the third best player before it disbanded. She is the younger sister of former Achiga mahjong player Atarashi Nozomi. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Matsumi Kuro
character.description: Matsumi Kuro is a second year at Achiga Girls School. Before the club was disband Kuro was the number one player. Afterward she kept the room clean in hopes that someone would show up and that they could have fun together. She is the younger sister of Matsumi Yuu. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Matsumi Yuu
character.description: Matsumi Yuu is a third year at Achiga Girls School. Yuu is the older sister of Matsumi Kuro and the fourth member to join the new club. When she was younger she wanted to join with the others in the mahjong club but she felt it would be awkward because she was older. Yuu is very sensitive to the cold, so she covers herself head to toe when she goes anywhere. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Sagimori Arata
character.description: Sagimori Arata is a second year at Achiga Girls School. Arata is the last member to join the team and is also a huge fan of Akado Harue. When she was little she used to play mahjong with the Matsumi sisters but stopped playing all together when Harue quit. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Hirose Sumire
character.description: Hirose Sumire is a friend of Teru and the only person known to Teru who seems to have had prior knowledge of Saki`s existence. She is often noted to treat Teru `coldly` when referring to Saki. 3rd year.

character.name: Nijou Izumi
character.description: Nijou Izumi is a first year at Senriyama All Girls School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Onjouji Toki
character.description: Onjouji Toki is a third year at Senriyama All Girls School. She is a sickly person. Her closest friend and caretaker is Ryuuka Shimizudani. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Eguchi Sara
character.description: Eguchi Sara is a third year at Senriyama All Girls School. As a second year she was the teams ace player and did very well during the interhigh tournament. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Shimizudani Ryuuka
character.description: Shimizudani Ryuuka is a third year at Senriyama All Girls School. She is best friend and caretaker to Toki Onjouji. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Funakubo Hiroko
character.description: Funakubo Hiroko is a second year at Senriyama All Girls School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kokaji Sukoya
character.description: Kokaji Sukoya is a professional mahjong player and works as a commentator for the All Japan High School Mahjong Tournament along with Kouko Fukuyo. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Fukuyo Kouko
character.description: Fukuyo Kouko is the announcer of the East Tokyo qualification tournament and one of several announcers of the 71st Inter High School Mahjong Championships. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Akado Harue
character.description: Akado Harue is the coach at her alma mater Achiga Girls School. Akado Harue was once known as the Legend of Achiga and was previously a professional mahjong player. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Gibbard Sakurako
character.description: Gibbard Sakurako is a member of the Achiga childrens mahjong club before it was disband. Sakurako is now in Achiga`s middle school. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Mihirogi Uta
character.description: Mihirogi Uta is a color commentator for the inter-high and a professional mahjong player. She is paired with Hariu Eri. Uta is very knowledgeable but prone to be a bit flighty. Later when Kouko Fukuyo and Sukoya Kokaji get slated to call Shiraitodai`s semi-finals match, she noted to Eri that they could use a break and called her jealous when she said Kouko was terrible. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Yamaya Hina
character.description: Yamaya Hina was a member of the Achiga children`s mahjong club before it was disbanded. She is now in Achiga`s middle school.

character.name: Atarashi Nozomi
character.description: Atarashi Nozomi is Atarashi Ako`s older sister, a previous member of the Achiga Girls` Academy`s mahjong team, and a former teammate of Harue Akado. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Hariu Eri
character.description: Hariu Eri is an announcer of the 71st Inter High School Mahjong Championships. She is partnered with professional mahjong player Mihirogi Uta. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kobashiri Yae
character.description: Kobashiri Yae is a third year at Bansei High. Yae first appears leaving a supermarket and wonders whats with the stunned look on her teammates faces. She then notices what they were looking at and tells them the one in the jersey might be a good opponent but it doesn`t matter because she`s been playing longer. During the individual tournament her match was briefly shown. Here she was quickly defeated by Matsumi Kuro. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Okahashi Hatsuse
character.description: Okahashi Hatsuse is a first-year student at Bansei High School. She is a former member of Ada Middle School`s mahjong club and was friends with Atarashi Ako. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Tatsumi Yuka
character.description: Tatsumi Yuka is a second year at Bansei High. She is only shown briefly before her team is defeated. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Maruse Noriko
character.description: Maruse Noriko is a third year at Bansei High. She is briefly shown along wit her teammates before being defeated. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kimura Hina
character.description: Kimura Hina is a third year at Bansei High. She is briefly shown before her team is defeated. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Ueda Ryouko
character.description: Ueda Ryouko is a third year at Bansei High. She is only shown briefly before her team is defeated. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Moriai Manami
character.description: Moriai Manami is a third-year student at Urabandai High School in Fukushima Prefecture. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kumakura Toshi
character.description: Kumakura Toshi is the team consultant for Miyamori Girl`s High. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Shinmen Nagi
character.description: Shinmen Nagi is a third-year student at Sanomo High School in Okayama Prefecture. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Terasaki Yuzuki
character.description: Terasaki Yuzuki is a third-year student at Imizu Integrated High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Arai Sophia
character.description: Arai Sophia is a third year at Koshigaya All Girls. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Asami Hanako
character.description: Asami Hanako is a third year at Koshigaya All Girls. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Mizumura Shiori
character.description: Mizumura Shiori is a first year at Koshigaya All Girls. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Utsuki Tamako
character.description: Utsuki Tamako is a third year at Koshigaya All Girls. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Yagihara Keiko
character.description: Yagihara Keiko is a second year at Koshigaya All Girls. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Hanada Kirame
character.description: Hanada Kirame is a second-year student at Shindouji Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Shibuya Takami
character.description: Shibuya Takami is a second year at Shiraitodai High. She is always shown drinking tea. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Matano Seiko
character.description: Matano Seiko is a second year at Shiraitodai High. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Oohoshi Awai
character.description: Oohoshi Awai is a first year at Shiraitodai High School. She is confirmed to be a powerful opponent. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Arakawa Kei
character.description: Arakawa Kei is a second year member of the Sangamaki mahjong club in North Oosaka. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Atago Masae
character.description: Atago Masae is the coach of the Senriyama mahjong team. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Shirouzu Mairu
character.description: Shirouzu Mairu is a student at Shindouji Girls` High School and captain of the mahjong team. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Tsuruta Himeko
character.description: Tsuruta Himeko is a student at Shindouji Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Yasukouchi Yoshiko
character.description: Yasukouchi Yoshiko is a third year student at Shindouji Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Ezaki Hitomi
character.description: Ezaki Hitomi is a third year student at Shindouji Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Fujiwara Rise
character.description: Fujiwara Rise is a third-year student at Kyushu Sekizan High School in Kagoshima Prefecture. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Tsuiki Moko
character.description: Tsuiki Moko is a first-year student at Kakuouzan High School in western Aichi Prefecture. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Nakiri Ranko
character.description: Nakiri Ranko is a second-year high school student at Koudo Academy in Shizuoka Prefecture.Ranko is the top ranked player in Shizuoka Prefecture. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Jindai Komaki
character.description: Jindai Komaki is a second year of Eisui Girls` High School. Referred to as "Princess" by her teammates and she is an average player when awake, but is considered as a national-class monster when asleep. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Kosegawa Shiromi
character.description: Kosegawa Shiromi is a third year at Miyamori Girl`s High, plays vanguard position. She is stoic, quiet, and apathetic. She is very tactical during her matches. According to her teammates, Shiromi has a unique style. When she worries about her hand, it usually means that its high scoring and normally scores her points this way. She is tactful when it comes to her opponents hands and has solid defense. She often discards what others call risky tiles, but it hasn`t been shown to backfire on her. Source: Wiki

character.name: Ueshige Suzu
character.description: Ueshige Suzu is a second year at Himematsu High, plays vanguard position. Kyouko recommended her on the team because of her ability to win explosively albeit rarely. Can do well if the game is all simples. If she fails at a task given to her by Kyouko, as punishment, Kyouko will write something on her forehead. Kyouko says she usually wins explosively the stronger her opponent gets, although sometimes she misfires. Source: Wiki

episode.title: 全国
The Nationals
Le tournoi national
Zenkoku
episode.summary: It’s the start of the Nationals, and there are many teams with strong players aiming for the top spot. Kuro Matsumi is the first from Achiga to play in the competition. Her challengers think she is weak, but she will show them the Dragon Road. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 接触
Contact
Contact
Sesshoku
episode.summary: At the prefectural tournament, the Achiga team defeats Bansei in the first round and eventually qualify to the nationals. To train for the nationals, Harue schedules the club to play against prefectural runner-ups. Immediately, Ako utters "Nagano", Kiyosumi`s prefecture, as the first one to visit, and therefore, they play Ryuumonbuchi High. There, Amae Koromo overwhelmingly defeats Shizuno but doesn`t discourage her or the team. Then, the excited team proceed to defeat other schools at other prefectures. After a ten day training camp, the girls set off for the nationals. Whilst stopping at a rest stop, Shizuno and the others meet Onjouji Toki and Shimizudani Ryuuka from Senriyama Girl`s High, who are also seeded in the nationals. As the club finally reach the nationals, they briefly pass by Miyanaga Saki. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 始動
Beginning
Démarrage
Shidou
episode.summary: Kuro takes Shizuno and Ako to meet her older sister, Yuu, who she invites to become the fourth member of the mahjong club. The next day, Kuro asks her classmate, Sagimori Arata, a fan of Harue during her prime, who agrees to join the club. During Winter, Harue, whose company`s manga team has since become defunct, decides to visit Achiga for old time`s sake, where she is surprised to find Shizuno and the others playing. Wanting to experience the inter-high nationals once more, Harue decides to become the club`s advisor. As the new year comes and the mahjong club is officially formed, the girls begin training for the prefecture preliminaries. Later, Ako encounters some of her former classmates who went on to Bansei High, who are due to become their opponents in the preliminaries. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 邂逅
Chance Meeting
Le hasard d`une rencontre
Kaikou
episode.summary: During elementary school, Takakamo Shizuno and Atarashi Ako make friends with the recently transferred Haramura Nodoka. Upon hearing about her interest in mahjong, Shizuno and Ako take Nodoka to Achiga Girl`s Academy, where she meets Akado Harue who runs a mahjong club for children. Nodoka starts playing mahjong with the others, including the clubs top player, Matsumi Kuro. Shizuno later explains to Nodoka how Harue was Achiga`s ace mahjong player, who ended up quitting after being defeated in a tournament, leading to the main club being disbanded. As time passes, Harue is scouted for a company`s mahjong team which leads to the closure of the children`s club. As Shizuno and Nodoka enter Achiga upon reaching middle school, Nodoka reveals she is going to be transferred the next spring. As the years pass, Shizuno, now in her third year, sees Nodoka on television winning the individual tournament. Wanting to reach the inter-high national tournament, Shizuno goes to Achiga`s club room where she encounters Kuro and decides to revive the mahjong club so she can meet Nodoka again. Upon hearing of this, Ako, who had went to a different middle school, decides she wants to enroll into Achiga and join the club. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 信念
Conviction
Certitude
Shinnen
episode.summary: Arata’s turn at the board went well, but it didn’t provide the necessary boost to Achiga’s points. The last player, Shizu, is going in with all eyes on her and her unique but dangerous play style. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奪回
Recovery
Reconquête
Dakkai
episode.summary: After Senriyama domination of the first round, Achiga is left in last place. Yuu promises to get the lost points back in her game. And Ako`s speed play disrupts the pace of the other players. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強豪
Veteran
Les vétérans
Kyougou
episode.summary: Matsumi`s dragon road has been shut down by Toki, the player from Senriyama. It is as if she can predict what tiles will be played. With such a frightening power, do any of the other players stand a chance? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 連荘
Dealer`s Streak
Mains bonus
Renchan
episode.summary: Miyanaga Teru is unstoppable. The players are trying reaching their breaking pot and new techniques must be used. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強
Best
La meilleure
Saikyou
episode.summary: Miyanaga Teru is known for dominating games and with each win she earns more points. Kuro hasn’t been able to make a move and the ace, Toki from Senriyama, is unable to stop her streak. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 修業
Training
Entraînement
Shugyou
episode.summary: Tournament rules say that individual players can’t practice with players outside of their own school. Using this rule, the girls invite players to practice against their team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
Promise
Promesse
Yakusoku
episode.summary: Playing against a champion has forced the girls to evaluate their plays styles and never give up fighting for points. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決意
Determination
Détermination
Ketsui
episode.summary: The stress of the game is starting to affect the players, some faster than others. One player in particular might not make it to the end of the game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激化
Aggravation
Intensificaton
Gekika
episode.summary: With the fourth round coming to an end, all bets are off as the players discover new talents and push their abilities to the limit. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 憧憬
Aspiration
Aspiration
Doukei
episode.summary: As the fourth players` match begins, Arata tries to bring Achiga into the lead, while defending their current second place. Source: crunchyroll, edited

episode.title: 混戦
Free For All
Mêlée confuse
Konsen
episode.summary: As the second match gets underway, Harue starts having practise matches with Kuro in order to revive her dora drawing ability. Izumi is put under pressure by Yoshiko and Sumire. Yuu, on the other hand, had been taught by Harue about an unconscious tell of Sumire`s which gives away who she is targeting, giving her the opportunity to strike back at her. After the second round ends, the third round begins and soon turns into a heated battle between Ako, Sera and Shiraitodai`s Shibuya Takami. Source: Wikipedia
